title: 1. Getting Started
content: Welcome to the framework. This guide will help you set up your project from scratch. First, ensure you have Node.js v18+ installed on your machine.

title: 2. Installation
content:
Run the following command in your terminal to install the dependencies:

npm install @standard/core --save

title: 3. Configuration
content:
Create a config.json file in your root directory. Use the following structure:

{
  "port": 3000,
  "debug": true
}

title: 4. Core Concepts
content: Our architecture follows the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern. This ensures a clean separation of concerns and easier testing protocols.

title: 5. API Endpoints
content:
The following endpoints are available for data fetching:

  • GET /users - List all users
  • POST /users - Create a new user
  • DELETE /users/:id - Remove a user

title: 6. Authentication
content: We use JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for session management. All protected routes require a Bearer Token in the Authorization header.

title: 7. Styling Guide
content:
The UI is built using utility-first CSS. You can customize the theme using the theme.config.js file.

TIP Use CSS variables for brand colors.

title: 9. Deployment
content: For production, we recommend using Docker. Ensure your environment variables are set correctly before running the container.

title: 10. Troubleshooting
content:
Common issues include:

  1. Port already in use: Change the port in config.
  2. CORS errors: Update your allowed origins list.
  3. Memory leaks: Check your middleware logic.
